description.narrative: The Regional Assistance Mission to Solomon Islands (RAMSI) Infrastructure and Related Services Program (RIRSP) provides infrastructure services for Solomon Islands Government (SIG) RAMSI Partnership Framework through the three RAMSI pillars. The two operational components relevant to the delivery of these services are: (1) The Infrastructure Management Unit which has oversight of the Facility contractor. The unit also has a significant role in providing quality advice in interpreting and achieving the infrastructure outcomes out the RAMSI pillars and; managing the relationships between the various stakeholders which includes key personnel within the RAMSI pillars, AusAID, Solomon Island Government and the Facility; and (2) The Facility for RIRSP which has responsibility for the concept development, design, sub-contracting, monitoring and achievement of infrastructure outcomes as tasked through the Infrastructure Management Unit. The total value of this initiative is $8.7 million over
